bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to W. Branks Stewart, November 26, 1941

div1.p: Hench requests a photograph of a bas-relief memorializing the yellow fever board.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to W. Branks Stewart, November 26, 1941
div1.opener:
Copy to Postell
November 26, 1941
Mr. W. B. Stewart
Medical Artist
Louisiana State University
Medical Center
New Orleans, La.
My dear Mr. Stewart:
div1.p:
About three weeks ago I visited the Agramonte Memorial Library
in New Orleans in pursuance of my interest in the story of the conquest
of yellow fever which interest is partially demonstrated by the enclosed
reprint. While there I admired the bas - relief in the hall outside the
library, the memorial to the yellow fever board. I tried to learn from
Mr. Postell, the librarian, if I could find a photograph or diagram of
this memorial. He knew of none and unfortunately you were not in your
office when we called. I would be very grateful if you could tell me
whether a photograph is available or not. I have visited Miss Agramonte
twice and have had much correspondence with her. I know she too would
be very grateful if a copy of the memorial could be made available to us
both.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
